newsArray.title: 14 fifties in last 51 innings: Pujara continues his quest for a century!
creator: The News Glory
newsArray.description: Chatogram: In the first Test match against the Bangladesh team, Indian player Pujara faced 203 balls and got out by scoring 90 runs. He has scored 14 fifties in his last 51 Test innings. However, his quest for a century continues. Pujara is one of the senior players in the Indian team. He is playing [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: Chatogram: In the first Test match against the Bangladesh team, Indian player Pujara faced 203 balls and got out by scoring 90 runs. He has scored 14 fifties in his last 51 Test innings. However, his quest for a century continues. Pujara is one of the senior players in the Indian team. He is playing as a regular batsman in the Test team. He played 97 Test matches and scored 6882 runs in 165 innings. This includes 18 centuries and 35 fifties. In the ongoing Test match against Bangladesh, Pujara along with youngsters Pant and Shreyas Iyer has rescued the struggling team. He was amazing by forming a partnership of 64 runs with Pant and 149 runs with Shreyas. However, he could not register a century. At the end of the first day‚Äôs play, the Indian team has scored 278 runs after losing 6 wickets in 90 overs. Shreyas Iyer will continue tomorrow‚Äôs match with 82 runs. He had last scored 193 runs against Australia in Sydney in 2019. Since then he has not registered a century in the 51 innings he has played so far. However, he has recorded 14 half-centuries in this intervening period. He has been dismissed twice in these last 51 innings of over 90+ runs. He has lost his wicket once in 80+ runs and twice in 70+ runs. Pujara is the 8th highest run-scorer in Test cricket for the Indian team. Kohli is at the 6th position with 8075 runs. Sachin (15,921 runs) is on the first position, Dravid (13,265 runs) is on the second position and Gavaskar (10,122 runs) is on the third position.

newsArray.title: 'Messi'ah of Millions: Indian fans wait for Messi's '2011 Tendulkar moment'
newsArray.description: When you see Messi running circles around the best in the world and then make them chase shadows -- like he did with defender Josko Gvardiol on Tuesday night in Doha -- the world appears to be magical. Maybe that's why you want him so badly to win the elusive Holy Grail of football, just as you yearned for Sachin Tendulkar to win the cricket World Cup, which eluded him five times until 2011 in Mumbai.

newsArray.title: India vs Bangladesh 1st Test: Kohli's dismissal, Pujara-Iyer stand, top moments from Day 1
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: India vs Bangladesh 1st Test: Kohli's dismissal, Pujara-Iyer stand, top moments from Day 1
newsArray.content: India endured a tough start on Day 1 of the first Test against hosts Bangladesh in Chattogram on Wednesday, but knocks from Cheteshwar Pujara (90) and Shreyas Iyer (82 not out) helped the visitors fight back.At the end of the opening day of the Test series, India posted 278/6 on the board, having just lost Axar Patel for 14 on the final delivery of the day.Virat Kohli failed to make an impact, while KL Rahul, who is captaining India in this Test due to injured Rohit Sharma‚Äôs absence, managed just 22 off 54 balls, going at a strike-rate of just above 40.Both teams had their moments on the opening day, but the century-stand between Shreyas Iyer and Cheteshwar Pujara leaves the match evenly poised with four days remaining.Let‚Äôs now check out four top moments from Day 1:India‚Äôs poor start‚ÄúThe game is played over five days so it is important to break it down to smaller targets. In every session, the demands would be different but one thing is sure that you are going to see a lot of aggressive cricket from our side,‚Äù India stand-in skipper KL Rahul had said recently, ahead of the match.However, there was no aggressive approach seen among the visiting openers on Wednesday.While the opening duo of Rahul and Shubman Gill did manage to hit boundaries at regular intervals during the first seven overs, with Rahul even cutting through point against Shakib Al Hasan at one stage, the boundaries were hard to come by for India following that phase.Shubman Gill too scored three fours including a pull shot off Ebadot Hossain, but fell for the paddle sweep off Taijul Islam, as Gill was caught by Yasir Ali at slip after getting a top edge off his bat.KL Rahul and Virat Kohli soon followed after, with the duo being dismissed within an over‚Äôs gap between the 19th and 20th to leave India at 48-3 at one stage.Virat Kohli‚Äôs cheap dismissalVirat Kohli, whose last Test hundred had come against Bangladesh in November 2019, was dismissed cheaply this time, falling for just one run.Facing Taijul Islam in the 20th over, Kohli was trapped LBW plumb in front of middle stump. Kohli had a chat with Pujara at the other end and went for the review with three seconds remaining, but UltraEdge confirmed there was no bat involved and ball-tracking showed it was clearly hitting the stumps.Kohli was stuck on the back foot while trying to playing it to leg side, but the ball ended up spinning sharply and eventually struck Kohli on the backpad.Cheteshwar Pujara misses tonCheteshwar Pujara has been in the nervous nineties phase before, and on Wednesday, he was victim of yet another dismissal in the 90s.Pujara had got to his half-century in 125 deliveries, but failed to convert it into a century, being dismissed for 90 by Taijul Islam.Taijul came up with a flatter ball pitching on middle, and turned enough to beat the outside edge, eventually hitting the off-stump and knocking the bails off.Notably, Pujara last scored a Test century for India in January 2019, when he amassed 193 against Australia in Sydney. The wait for another Test century goes on for Pujara.Pujara-Iyer standCheteshwar Pujara and Shreyas Iyer played pivotal roles in India‚Äôs recovering on Day one of the first Test against Bangladesh. While Pujara was involved in a 64-run stand with Rishabh Pant (46), Pujara went onto forge 149-run stand with Shreyas Iyer for the fifth wicket.That partnership stabilised India‚Äôs innings, and that helped India win some momentum going into day two, and while India have lost Pujara, Shreyas Iyer remains unbeaten on 82.They may have just four wickets in hand, but India will look to get past the 300-run mark in the first session on Day 2 to make it tough for Bangladesh in their first-innings reply, while Shreyas Iyer searches for what will be just his second Test century.Read all the Latest News, Trending News, Cricket News, Bollywood News, India News and Entertainment News here. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

newsArray.title: India Women vs Australia Women LIVE: Harmanpreet Kaur and Co eye series lead in 3rd T20I
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: India Women vs Australia Women LIVE: Harmanpreet Kaur and Co eye series lead in 3rd T20I
newsArray.content: India Women vs Australia Women LIVE: Indians opt to bowl, Aussies make three changes to XI IND W vs AUS W 3rd T20I LIVE cricket score and updates: India bring Rajeshwari Gayakwad in place of Meghana Singh while Australia make three changes to their XI Live Updates Highlights 18:53 (IST) Australia XI : Alyssa Healy (c/wk), Beth Mooney, Tahlia McGrath, Ashleigh Gardner, Ellyse Perry, Grace Harris, Annabel Sutherland, Heather Graham, Alana King, Darcie Brown, Megan Schutt Three changes for the Aussies: IN: Harris, Carey, Brown; OUT: Litchfield, Graham, Garth 18:52 (IST) India XI : Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Shafali Verma, Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues, Devika Vaidya, Richa Ghosh (wk), Deepti Sharma, Radha Yadav, Anjali Sarvani, Rajeshwari Gayakwad, Renuka Thakur Just one change for the hosts: Rajeshwari Gayakwad replaces Meghana Singh 18:33 (IST) TOSS: Team India win the toss, and skipper Harmanpreet Kaur opts to field 18:30 (IST) The action shifts to Mumbai's iconic Brabourne, which will host the remainder of the series üìç Brabourne Stadium, Mumbai An hour ‚Äòtil the third T20I gets underway! #INDvAUS pic.twitter.com/CPuPk8av6K ‚Äî Australian Women's Cricket Team üèè (@AusWomenCricket) December 14, 2022 18:26 (IST) Was quite a memorable occasion the last time these two teams met, with over 47,000 spectators turning up at the DY Patil Stadium on Sunday A victory lap to honour the crowd who were in attendance to support the women in blue Over 47,000 in attendance for the second T20I who witnessed a thriller here at the DY Patil Stadium üëè üëè Keep cheering for Women in Blue üëç üëç #TeamIndia | #INDvAUS | @mastercardindia pic.twitter.com/CtzdsyhxZu ‚Äî BCCI Women (@BCCIWomen) December 11, 2022 18:15 (IST) In front of an unprecedented 47,000+ fans at the DY Patil Stadium, Harmanpreet Kaur and Co produced a performance that should surely inspire a few more to take up the sport. But as they move from Navi Mumbai to Mumbai for the third T20I of the match, they also need to move on quickly from the win. Preview: Plenty of work still to do for hosts despite famous Super Over win 17:58 (IST) Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the third T20I between India and Australia at the Brabourne Stadium, with the Women in Blue hoping to carry the momentum from their thrilling Super Over win over this game and go 2-1 up in the five-match series. Highlights 18:53 (IST) Australia XI : Alyssa Healy (c/wk), Beth Mooney, Tahlia McGrath, Ashleigh Gardner, Ellyse Perry, Grace Harris, Annabel Sutherland, Heather Graham, Alana King, Darcie Brown, Megan Schutt Three changes for the Aussies: IN: Harris, Carey, Brown; OUT: Litchfield, Graham, Garth 18:52 (IST) India XI : Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Shafali Verma, Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues, Devika Vaidya, Richa Ghosh (wk), Deepti Sharma, Radha Yadav, Anjali Sarvani, Rajeshwari Gayakwad, Renuka Thakur Just one change for the hosts: Rajeshwari Gayakwad replaces Meghana Singh 18:33 (IST) TOSS: Team India win the toss, and skipper Harmanpreet Kaur opts to field India women vs Australia women, LIVE Cricket Score: Australia captain Alyssa Healy and India counterpart Harmanpreet Kaur pose with the series trophy. AFP 3rd T20I Preview : Buoyed by their thrilling series-leveling victory after taking the game into the Super Over, the India women‚Äôs cricket team will hope to surge ahead in the five-match series against Australia in the third T20I at Mumbai‚Äôs Brabourne Stadium. The action shifts to Brabourne Stadium in the southern end of Mumbai, just a few kilometres away from the Wankhede Stadium where the BCCI is headquartered. The Women in Blue made a fine comeback in the second T20I in front of a sold-out DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai after suffering a nine-wicket thrashing in the opening game. While the Indians could collect just one wicket in the second game as well, it was their batting department that primarily helped stage the turnaround, with Smriti Mandhana (79) and Richa Ghosh (26 not out) helping the side finish level on scores after being set 188 to win. India would then score 20 runs in the Super Over, 13 of which came of Mandhana‚Äôs bat. Seamer Renuka Singh would then bowl out a tidy over to ensure the hosts were abreast with the world champions heading into the third game. Squads : India : Smriti Mandhana, Shafali Verma, Jemimah Rodrigues, Harmanpreet Kaur(c), Richa Ghosh(w), Deepti Sharma, Devika Vaidya, Radha Yadav, Anjali Sarvani, Meghna Singh, Renuka Thakur Singh, Rajeshwari Gayakwad, Sabbhineni Meghana, Harleen Deol, Yastika Bhatia. Australia : Alyssa Healy(w/c), Beth Mooney, Tahlia McGrath, Ashleigh Gardner, Ellyse Perry, Phoebe Litchfield, Annabel Sutherland, Heather Graham, Alana King, Kim Garth, Megan Schutt, Grace Harris, Nicola Carey, Darcie Brown. This is his first-class cricket match. Sachin Tendulkar is one of the legends of cricket world. A batsman who has scored thousands of runs in the international [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: Goa: Arjun Tendulkar, who made his debut for Goa in the ongoing Ranji Trophy series, hit a century in his first match. He scored this century against Rajasthan. This is his first-class cricket match. Sachin Tendulkar is one of the legends of cricket world. A batsman who has scored thousands of runs in the international cricket field for the Indian team. His son Arjun Tendulkar, who grew up watching him, also got interested in the game of cricket. A left-handed batsman and bowler, he played for Mumbai in local cricket.

newsArray.title: IND vs BAN First Test | Rishabh Pant has crossed 4,000 runs in international cricket
creator: The News Glory
newsArray.description: Chennai: Rishabh Pant, the wicket-keeper batsman of the Indian cricket team, has crossed 4,000 runs in the international cricket arena. In the same match, he also holds the record of being the fastest Indian batsman to hit 50 sixes in Test cricket. He has achieved this in a total of 54 Test innings. After Dhoni, [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: Chennai: Rishabh Pant, the wicket-keeper batsman of the Indian cricket team, has crossed 4,000 runs in the international cricket arena. In the same match, he also holds the record of being the fastest Indian batsman to hit 50 sixes in Test cricket. He has achieved this in a total of 54 Test innings. After Dhoni, Pant has also created the record of being the Indian wicketkeeper batsman who has crossed 4000 runs in international cricket. The 25-year-old Pant has been playing international cricket for the Indian team since 2017. He has played 31 Tests, 30 ODIs and 66 T20Is so far. Through this he has accumulated a total of 4021 runs. He has scored 6 centuries and 18 fifties in these runs. 5 of these centuries were recorded in Test cricket. He has accumulated 159 runs in Test cricket, 125 runs in ODI cricket and 65 runs in T20 cricket. He has returned as a not-out batsman in all these three innings. He has taken a total of 158 catches as a wicket keeper. He has stumped 21 times. In Test cricket, he took 6 catches in a single innings. He scored 46 runs in the ongoing first Test against Bangladesh. It was in this innings that he set the milestone of 4000+ runs and the record for fastest 50 sixes. He came in to bat when the Indian team stumbled with the loss of 3 wickets for 48 runs. After a brilliant performance, Pant lost his wicket by scoring 46 runs off 45 balls due to poor shot selection in the same match. At the end of the first day of the Test match, the Indian team scored 278 runs, losing 6 wickets in 90 overs. Pujara was out on 90 runs. Shreyas Iyer is batting with 82 runs.

newsArray.title: Arjun Tendulkar scores century on Ranji Trophy debut, replicates father Sachin's feat
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: Arjun Tendulkar scores century on Ranji Trophy debut, replicates father Sachin's feat
newsArray.content: Cricket Arjun Tendulkar scores century on Ranji Trophy debut, replicates father Sachin's feat Arjun Tendulkar is playing for Goa, and not Mumbai, in order for more game time. He had represented Mumbai in last year's domestic season. FirstCricket Staff December 14th, 2022 14:57:10 IST File image of Arjun Tendulkar. Reuters Goa: Arjun Tendulkar repeated father Sachin Tendulkar‚Äôs feat of scoring a century on first class debut while representing Goa against Rajasthan in the Ranji Trophy on Wednesday. Sachin Tendulkar had also scored a century on his Ranji Trophy debut, almost exactly 34 years back. Tendulkar, then 15, had scored a century against Gujarat at the Wankhede Stadium. Arjun, 23, brought up the ton in 178 balls while coming in to bat at No 7. His inning witnessed 15 boundaries and two sixes at the Goa Cricket Association Academy. Arjun and Suyash S Prabhudesai stitched an unbeaten 209 run stand for the sixth wicket going into the Tea break. Prabhudesai, who came in at No 3, scored a century of his own. He was unbeaten on 172 runs at the break. Arjun Tendulkar is playing for Goa, and not Mumbai, in order for more game time. He had represented Mumbai in last year‚Äôs domestic season. The left arm seamer has 8 wickets in List A cricket and 12 wickets in T20s. Read all the Latest News , Trending News , Cricket News , Bollywood News , India News and Entertainment News here. newsArray.title: 'Young players more focused on playing T20 cricket': Brad Hogg on how IPL is affecting Indian cricket
creator: FP Trending
newsArray.description: 'Young players more focused on playing T20 cricket': Brad Hogg on how IPL is affecting Indian cricket
newsArray.content: Cricket 'Young players more focused on playing T20 cricket': Brad Hogg on how IPL is affecting Indian cricket Comparing the younger generation of players to greats like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, Hogg said that it was the newer players who were most affected by the shift to T20 cricket. FP Trending December 14th, 2022 14:56:19 IST File image of former Australia and KKR spinner Brad Hogg. Sportzpics The upcoming edition of the Indian Premier League is already being awaited by fans. The mini-auction ahead of the marquee tournament, which will be held on 23 December, will see the 10 teams bidding for players like Joe Root, Kane Williamson, Cameroon Green Holder and Ajinkya Rahane. While both cricketers and franchises are gearing up for the IPL 2023 mini-auction, former Australia cricketer Brad Hogg is of a different opinion about the tournament‚Äôs role in cricket. The spinner has claimed that the cash-rich league is having an adverse effect on the sport as younger cricketers are more interested in playing T20s than the longer formats of the game. In an Instagram post, Brad Hogg said that IPL is affecting Indian cricket ‚Äúbecause the young players that are coming through the system are more focused on playing T20 IPL cricket because there is probably a little more cash in it, it‚Äôs a short form, it‚Äôs quick and you get the game done and dusted. It seems a bit like easier money.‚Äù He also said that due to the focus on T20 games, Tests and ODIs take a backseat. Watch: View this post on Instagram A post shared by Brad Hogg (@brad_hogg) Comparing the younger generation of players to greats like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, Hogg said that it was the newer players who were most affected by the shift to T20 cricket. ‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt know how bowlers set up batters to take wickets and how batters build their innings to bat for long periods of time,‚Äù the Aussie all-rounder added. The video has garnered several responses with several people disagreeing with Brad Hogg‚Äôs comments. Many people credited the IPL with bringing forward new talent. Others said it all came down to the viewers. ‚ÄúWell it‚Äôs not impacting anything in the end sports is business. If more people watch test cricket, then ipl players will make more money by playing tests and they will focus more there. So just enjoy cricket,‚Äù commented one person. ‚ÄúTournaments like Ranji, Syed Mustaq Ali are equally helping players to develop in other formats. It‚Äôs just that obviously there is more focus and money in t20 cricket‚Äù, wrote another. Read all the Latest News , Trending News , Cricket News , Bollywood News , India News and Entertainment News here. Follow us on Facebook , Twitter and Instagram . newsArray.title: 'Problems arise when you seek advice from outsiders': Shahid Afridi on Babar Azam's captaincy
creator: FP Trending
newsArray.description: 'Problems arise when you seek advice from outsiders': Shahid Afridi on Babar Azam's captaincy
newsArray.content: Cricket 'Problems arise when you seek advice from outsiders': Shahid Afridi on Babar Azam's captaincy Shahid Afridi also criticised the fans for putting all the blame on Pakistan captain Babar Azam after the Test series loss to England. FP Trending December 14th, 2022 14:40:32 IST Pakistan captain Babar Azam. AP Pakistan‚Äôs performance in Test cricket has come under the scanner since the side suffered their third consecutive Test defeat on home soil, for the first time in 63 years. They have already lost the three-match series against England with the second loss in a row In the second Test, the Babar Azam-led side fell 26 runs short of the 355-run target in the fourth innings following a batting disaster. Among several controversies, skipper Azam‚Äôs leadership ability , especially in Tests has become the talk of the town. Referring to the topic, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi slammed the opener for not taking suggestions from senior members of the squad. Prior to Pakistan‚Äôs defeat in the second Test, Afridi revealed his thoughts about the unit‚Äôs disappointing results in recent times while featuring in a discussion on Samaa TV . According to him, Azam is relying more on advice from outsiders rather than listening to the veteran cricketers. Thus, he went on to make some blunders in the planning procedure and also in taking crucial in-match calls. Reminiscing his tenure as the Pakistan skipper, Afridi explained, ‚ÄúAs a captain, I always believed that being a good leader requires bringing all the players together. It implies that you should talk to seniors about your ideas. Problems arise when you start seeking advice from outsiders while excluding senior folks.‚Äù However, Afridi showed his trust in Azam‚Äôs batting capability. Though the right-handed batter could not live up to the expectations during the fourth-innings chase, the former cricketer refused to doubt him. Fans at the Multan Cricket Stadium went outrageous after Azam departed early scoring just 1 run at an important moment. After his dismissal, the crowd was heard chanting ‚ÄúZimBabar‚Äù in the stands. The gesture from the home supporters did not go down well with Afridi. He noted, ‚ÄúIf we don‚Äôt respect our players, the rest of the world won‚Äôt either.‚Äù The 45-year-old strongly criticised the fans for putting all the blame on the captain as each of the players should equally bear the responsibility for the loss. ‚ÄúBabar Azam is the backbone of the team. In the series, he has not performed too badly. He doesn‚Äôt play squash or table tennis to win a match for his team alone. If the team doesn‚Äôt perform, we can‚Äôt expect enough from any one person. He is the captain and is responsible for many things. He is our hero and will always be,‚Äù Afridi added further. Read all the Latest News , Trending News , Cricket News , Bollywood News , India News and Entertainment News here. Follow us on Facebook , Twitter and Instagram . newsArray.title: BAN vs IND: Rishabh Pant breaches 4000-run mark in international cricket
creator: ANI
newsArray.content: Rishabh Pant on Wednesday breached the 4000-run mark in international cricket. Pant accomplished this feat during the first innings of the opening Test against Bangladesh. After three quick wickets, Bangladesh were right on top with India having lost the star likes of Virat Kohli, KL Rahul, and Shubman Gill. However, vice-captain Cheteshwar Pujara and Rishabh Pant showed some resurgence with a 37-run partnership stand while the Men in Blue were in serious trouble. Pant‚Äôs aggression has helped India, which has lost three games in a row after a strong start. Taijul struck twice, including Kohli‚Äôs head, and Khaled dispatched the India captain. Pant, on the other hand, has already struck four boundaries and a six in his 26-ball 29* to lead the recovery after being promoted. After India opted to bat, Taijul Islam was the one who eventually broke through in the Indian batting order. Shubman Gill attempted to lap-sweep a full delivery at the start of the drinks break, but the ball simply plummeted at him, inducing a top edge. Yasir Ali came around from the first slip and grabbed it, expecting the shot. KL Rahul soon collapsed, falling prey to Khaled‚Äôs delivery on his stumps. In the next over, Virat Kohli was trapped lbw by a length ball from Taijul that spun past his outside edge. That meant India, who appeared to be in out of control at 41 for no loss, were suddenly in trouble. Pujara and Pant batted in their respective ways for the remainder of the session. Pant even skipped down the pitch to hit Taijul for a six-over wide long-on. At lunch, he was on 29 off 26, while Pujara was on 12 off 32. (ANI) ALSO READ: Iranian govt executed over 500 people in 2022, highest in 5 years: Report This report is filed by ANI news service. TheNewsMill holds no responsibility for this content.

newsArray.title: As√≠ celebraron en Asia el triunfo, los seguidores de Messi
newsArray.description: Gazi Jahidul Haque ten√≠a problemas por disimular su nerviosismo antes de la semifinal del Mundial entre Argentina y Croacia en el estadio Lusail de Qatar.Haque segu√≠a el juego desde Daca, la capital de Bangladesh.} RELACIONADAS F√∫tbol Scaloni, el novato DT que busca su diploma de honor en Qatar F√∫tbol Messi ir√° por su revancha con Argentina, finalista en Qatar F√∫tbol Resultados y calendario de la Copa Mundial de F√∫tbol de Qatar 2022 "Este Mundial no s√≥lo es importante para Argentina, sino tambi√©n para Messi", dijo Haque, abogado de 35 a√±os, antes del encuentro. Su voz apenas se o√≠a entre las miles de personas reunidas a su espalda para ver el juego ante una pantalla gigante en la Universidad de Daca, en el centro de la capital.Era medianoche en Daca, y para cuando son√≥ el silbato final y Argentina hab√≠a ganado a Croacia 3-0, hac√≠a tiempo que las preocupaciones de Haque estaban olvidadas. Argentina estaba en la final del Mundial, a una victoria de hacerse con el trofeo m√°s importante del f√∫tbol.La victoria supon√≠a que Haque podr√≠a ver a Messi, un jugador ampliamente considerado como uno de los mejores del mundo- una vez m√°s en el Mundial. Comenzaron las celebraciones.Los hinchas salieron a las calles en Daca con banderas argentinas y los colores de la albiceleste. Entre el sonido de las trompetas corearon el nombre de Messi y se abrazaban entre ellos. Algunos bailaban y cantaban. Un joven pas√≥ en un bicitaxi con el cuerpo pintado de azul y blanco. RELACIONADAS F√∫tbol √Ålvarez revoluciona a Argentina rumbo a otra final F√∫tbol Modric se va del Mundial pero comparte escenario con Messi La victoria argentina tambi√©n se celebr√≥ en la vecina India, donde normalmente es el cricket el deporte que despierta un fervor casi religioso.En la ciudad de Calcuta, donde tambi√©n hay ni√±os que llevan el nombre de futbolistas de otras generaciones, los hinchas argentinos marcharon por las calles cantando canciones en apoyo del equipo de Messi. Es una ciudad donde hay murales del astro argentino en los muros y banderas de Argentina asoman de los balcones.Argentina tiene una legi√≥n de superhinchas en Bangladesh e India desde los tiempos de Maradona, uno de los futbolistas m√°s grandes de todos los tiempos y s√≠mbolo para aficionados de todo el mundo. Miles de personas han viajado desde esos dos pa√≠ses para ver jugar a Messi y su equipo en Qatar. Te puede interesar Messi va a igualar el r√©cord de Matth√§us con 25 partidos en Mundiales Marroqu√≠es hacen cola por boletos gratis para semifinal Ante el enorme apoyo en el pa√≠s del sur de Asia, la Federaci√≥n Argentina dirigi√≥ un mensaje a los bangladesh√≠es en medios sociales este mes."¬°¬°Gracias por el apoyo a nuestro equipo!! ¬°Est√°n re locos como nosotros!", indic√≥ la federaci√≥n en un tuit con im√°genes de hinchas bangladesh√≠es con los colores de argentina.Los que no est√°n en Qatar muestran su afici√≥n y siguen los juegos con devoci√≥n desde casa.En poblados y ciudades costeras de Kerala, en el sur, donde se ven banderas de Argentina y Brasil en comercios, edificios y postes, la gente coloc√≥ enormes figuras de sus jugadores favoritos, en especial Messi y el brasile√±o Neymar. En los poblados se han aprovechado los espacios abiertos utilizados para mostrar los partidos y miles de personas han acudido a verlos en pantallas gigantes.Argentina se enfrentar√° a Francia o Marruecos en la final del domingo. El fervor alcanzar√° su m√°xima expresi√≥n en India, y Aditya Shriram sue√±a con un final de cuento de hadas para Messi. Un apoyo por a√±os Shriram, un publicista digital de 33 a√±os en Nueva Delhi, apoya a Argentina desde el Mundial de 1998. El domingo seguir√° la final con un grupo de casi dos docenas de amigos con los que jugaba al f√∫tbol de ni√±o en la capital india.Shriram dijo que el juego del domingo permitir√° a Messi consolidar su legado, ya que los considerados como mejores futbolistas de la historia -Pel√© y Maradona- ganaron el Mundial, un trofeo que el astro argentino no ha logrado a√∫n."Lo completar√°", dijo Shriram. "Si uno no gana el Mundial, no se le puede contar entre los absolutamente mejores de todos los tiempos".
newsArray.content: Gazi Jahidul Haque ten√≠a problemas por disimular su nerviosismo antes de la semifinal del Mundial entre Argentina y Croacia en el estadio Lusail de Qatar. Haque segu√≠a el juego desde Daca, la capital de Bangladesh.} "Este Mundial no s√≥lo es importante para Argentina, sino tambi√©n para Messi", dijo Haque, abogado de 35 a√±os, antes del encuentro. Su voz apenas se o√≠a entre las miles de personas reunidas a su espalda para ver el juego ante una pantalla gigante en la Universidad de Daca, en el centro de la capital. Era medianoche en Daca, y para cuando son√≥ el silbato final y Argentina hab√≠a ganado a Croacia 3-0, hac√≠a tiempo que las preocupaciones de Haque estaban olvidadas. Argentina estaba en la final del Mundial, a una victoria de hacerse con el trofeo m√°s importante del f√∫tbol. La victoria supon√≠a que Haque podr√≠a ver a Messi, un jugador ampliamente considerado como uno de los mejores del mundo- una vez m√°s en el Mundial. Comenzaron las celebraciones. Los hinchas salieron a las calles en Daca con banderas argentinas y los colores de la albiceleste . Entre el sonido de las trompetas corearon el nombre de Messi y se abrazaban entre ellos. Algunos bailaban y cantaban. Un joven pas√≥ en un bicitaxi con el cuerpo pintado de azul y blanco. La victoria argentina tambi√©n se celebr√≥ en la vecina India, donde normalmente es el cricket el deporte que despierta un fervor casi religioso. En la ciudad de Calcuta, donde tambi√©n hay ni√±os que llevan el nombre de futbolistas de otras generaciones, los hinchas argentinos marcharon por las calles cantando canciones en apoyo del equipo de Messi. Es una ciudad donde hay murales del astro argentino en los muros y banderas de Argentina asoman de los balcones. Argentina tiene una legi√≥n de superhinchas en Bangladesh e India desde los tiempos de Maradona, uno de los futbolistas m√°s grandes de todos los tiempos y s√≠mbolo para aficionados de todo el mundo. Miles de personas han viajado desde esos dos pa√≠ses para ver jugar a Messi y su equipo en Qatar. Ante el enorme apoyo en el pa√≠s del sur de Asia, la Federaci√≥n Argentina dirigi√≥ un mensaje a los bangladesh√≠es en medios sociales este mes. "¬°¬°Gracias por el apoyo a nuestro equipo!! ¬°Est√°n re locos como nosotros!", indic√≥ la federaci√≥n en un tuit con im√°genes de hinchas bangladesh√≠es con los colores de argentina. Los que no est√°n en Qatar muestran su afici√≥n y siguen los juegos con devoci√≥n desde casa. En poblados y ciudades costeras de Kerala, en el sur, donde se ven banderas de Argentina y Brasil en comercios, edificios y postes, la gente coloc√≥ enormes figuras de sus jugadores favoritos, en especial Messi y el brasile√±o Neymar. En los poblados se han aprovechado los espacios abiertos utilizados para mostrar los partidos y miles de personas han acudido a verlos en pantallas gigantes. Argentina se enfrentar√° a Francia o Marruecos en la final del domingo. El fervor alcanzar√° su m√°xima expresi√≥n en India, y Aditya Shriram sue√±a con un final de cuento de hadas para Messi. Shriram, un publicista digital de 33 a√±os en Nueva Delhi, apoya a Argentina desde el Mundial de 1998. El domingo seguir√° la final con un grupo de casi dos docenas de amigos con los que jugaba al f√∫tbol de ni√±o en la capital india. Shriram dijo que el juego del domingo permitir√° a Messi consolidar su legado, ya que los considerados como mejores futbolistas de la historia -Pel√© y Maradona- ganaron el Mundial, un trofeo que el astro argentino no ha logrado a√∫n. "Lo completar√°", dijo Shriram. "Si uno no gana el Mundial, no se le puede contar entre los absolutamente mejores de todos los tiempos". newsArray.title: Alyssa Healy: We‚Äôll bounce back from loss
newsArray.description: Cricket: Australia are looking to quickly bounce back after their first defeat of the year to India, according to Alyssa Healy.
newsArray.content: Cricket: Australia are looking to quickly bounce back after their first defeat of the year to India, according to Alyssa Healy.

newsArray.title: ‚ÄòCurve-balls‚Äô: Marnus expects South African barrage
newsArray.description: There‚Äôs no mixed allegiances for South African-born Aussie Test star Marnus Labuschagne ahead of a first-ever Test clash against his birth country even though he expects the tourists could throw some ‚Äúcurve-balls‚Äù his way in the sledging department.
newsArray.content: Labuschagne has become the world‚Äòs No.1 Test batsman in the three years since his debut at Lord‚Äôs in 2019, as a concussion sub, and hits the showdown with the Proteas off the back of a man-of-the series performance against the West Indies in which he belted 502 runs. He‚Äôs never played a Test against South Africa, but has played three ODI‚Äôs against them and scored a fairytale century against then in Potchefstroom in 2020. The 28-year-old, who moved to Australia when he was 10 and could only speak Afrikaans, conceded this series was ‚Äúa little bit closer to my heart‚Äù but he wouldn‚Äôt be taking his foot off the pedal have pounded out three hundreds including a double, in four innings against the Windies. ‚ÄúMy family have adopted Australia as their home and they support me, they support the Australian cricket team,‚Äù Labuschagne said ahead of the first Test in Brisbane starting on Saturday. ‚ÄúBut I certainly think it‚Äòs it‚Äôs always exciting what this Test holds because it is a little bit closer to my heart because it‚Äôs the country where I grew up and where I spent 10 years of my life.‚ÄùLabuschagne is also playing as a father for the first time after he and his wife, Rebekah welcomed their first child in September.Their daughter Hallie travelled to Perth and was introduced to his teammates in change rooms during the first Test against the Windies.Labuschagne said being a dad had helped him ‚Äúswitch off‚Äù from his cricket obsession, but wouldn‚Äôt end it. ‚ÄúWhen my family‚Äòs with me, certainly the two differences between when they were with me in Perth to when they weren‚Äôt with me in Adelaide,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI got to bed a lot later in Adelaide and I was watching a lot more cricket videos at night.In Perth that wasn‚Äòt the case, I was getting to bed earlier, putting her (Hallie) to bed.‚ÄúI am who I am is because I am obsessed and I am obsessive, I love to try and get better each time and each day.‚ÄúI think that part, hopefully it never stops for me because I think that‚Äòs what makes me who I am.‚Äù His South African background is also an inescapable part of who is and that wasn‚Äôt lost on South African captain Dean Elgar. ‚ÄúHe is one of the form batters in the world and I am sure there is going to be a little bit of extra spice knowing he is ex-South African as well,‚Äô‚Äô Elgar said.The Proteas skipper also recalled Labuschagne trying to unsettle him in a county game in England by speaking Afrikaans, and suggested they could be a ploy they use during the series. But Labuschagne is ready for whatever they send his way ‚ÄúI‚Äòve got no doubt that they‚Äôre going to throw some curve-balls,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúHopefully the responses can be either funny or none at all.‚Äú

newsArray.title: South Africa star‚Äôs explosive Smith ‚Äòmilking‚Äô claim
newsArray.description: Faf du Plessis has re-opened the wounds of cricket‚Äôs ugliest ever tour by accusing Steve Smith of ‚Äúmilking like a football player‚Äù in a showdown with explosive fast bowler Kagiso Rabada.
newsArray.content: In all the hypothesising about what events led to the Sandpapergate scandal, perhaps the most underplayed factor was the fury that erupted in the Australian camp two days before the Cape Town Test when Rabada was sensationally cleared at a six-hour appeal hearing of intentionally barging into Smith.On day one of the preceding second Test in Port Elizabeth, a fired-up Rabada made physical contact with Smith‚Äôs shoulder after dismissing the batsman, having already given David Warner an aggressive send-off. Rabada was charged over both incidents.‚ÄúThis episode has almost been forgotten against the backdrop of what the series still had up its sleeve, or more accurately, down its trousers,‚Äù wrote du Plessis in his recently released book.SCBBL PROMOIn his retelling of the events leading into the Sandpapergate Test, the former Proteas captain accused Smith of deliberately staging for Rabada to be cited by umpires.‚ÄúThey brushed shoulders during one of KG‚Äôs overs but Smith milked it like a football player,‚Äù wrote du Plessis.‚ÄúWe knew that KG was one demerit point away from a suspension.‚ÄùA tight-lipped Rabada only added to the anticipation over what might happen when he charges into Smith and Warner at the Gabba this weekend when he told News Corp he will refuse to discuss the heated clash with the world‚Äôs best batsman until after he‚Äôs retired.‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs happened has happened,‚Äô‚Äô Rabada told News Corp.‚ÄúI am not going to say anything now. After my career I might talk a bit more about it and look back at what happened. But at the moment we will move on.‚ÄúIt was definitely a Test series I will never forget and things did not end too well off the field.‚ÄùAfter originally copping a two match suspension which would have ruled him out of the remainder of the 2018 series, Rabada became one of the first players to ever have an ICC ban successfully overturned.The South Africans lawyered up for a marathon hearing where a bemused Smith was not even invited to give his version of events.Proteas quick Vernon Philander was another to accuse Smith of ‚Äúmilking‚Äù; claims the Australian captain rubbished at the time.‚ÄúThe contact was harder than it actually looked on the TV. Whether it was intentional or not that‚Äôs not for me to decide,‚Äù Smith said following the contentious hearing.‚ÄúI was going down the other end of the wicket to speak to Shaun (Marsh) who was in with me at the time.‚ÄúI think when you‚Äôve got someone out you‚Äôve already won the battle. There‚Äôs no need to go over the top. I was walking down the other end of the wicket, I certainly didn‚Äôt change my line or anything.‚Äú‚Ä¶ The ICC have set the standard, haven‚Äôt they? There was clearly contact out in the middle. I certainly won‚Äôt be telling my bowlers to go out there and after you take a wicket go and get in their space. I don‚Äôt think that is on and part of the game.‚ÄùRabada said in the wake of the incident that he would not change his emotional reactions after taking wickets.Sandpaper timeline‚ÄúNo I won‚Äôt change the way I express myself. I will just get far away from the batter.‚ÄùSmith told News Corp earlier this summer that he would not be intimidated should Rabada try and get in his face again.‚ÄúNah, I guess it‚Äôs all part of it. Chill out and go about your business and try and play,‚Äù said Smith.‚ÄúThat‚Äôs pretty much it. Just play the game.‚ÄúHe‚Äôs (Rabada) a competitor. He‚Äôs a terrific bowler. You just have to look at his record and he‚Äôs always at you.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to be a good summer with both their attack and our attack going at it. It should make for some entertaining cricket.‚ÄùSmith admitted this week he has been troubled more by South Africa‚Äôs hostile bowlers than any other attack he‚Äôs faced.‚ÄúSouth Africa‚Äôs probably the one team that have bowled pretty well to me in the past, my record‚Äôs probably not quite as good against them as some of the others,‚Äù Smith said.Only one of Smith‚Äôs 29 career Test hundreds has come against South Africa.

newsArray.title: ‚ÄòTimes have changed,‚Äô but AFL, NRL unlikely to follow cricket‚Äôs COVID lead
creator: Roy Ward
newsArray.description: The sight of cricketers Marcus Stoinis and Joe Burns playing after testing positive to COVID-19 on Tuesday was a shock to some, but the AFL is expecting its club doctors will keep infectious players away from teams.
newsArray.content: The vision of Melbourne Stars duo Marcus Stoinis and Joe Burns shivering by themselves as they played a Big Bash game after testing positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday night made for unusual viewing for Australians. However, while experts say the dramatic shift from the way Australian sports and leagues dealt with positive COVID-19 cases in previous seasons reflects the change in Australian attitudes, it‚Äôs unlikely the winter codes will be allowing players to run out while sick in 2023. Joe Burns and Marcus Stoinis had a miserable night after testing positive to COVID Credit: Getty Images Competitions such as the AFL and NRL are preparing to deal with COVID-19 in 2023 without state-based health orders making it compulsory for positive cases to isolate. The AFL said on Wednesday that club doctors would be tasked with treating players who test positive but the expectation is any positive players would be immediately sent home just as players with colds or gastro cases are treated. ‚ÄúThe health and safety of players, officials, fans, and the wider community is paramount,‚Äù the AFL said in a statement. ‚ÄúTherefore, the AFL will continue to closely monitor the situation with respect to COVID-19 and act in accordance with advice from government and medical experts. As a baseline principle, all players and club staff must comply with the requirements, rules, and instructions of the relevant authority (being the applicable government authority or body) in their state, and in any state to which they travel during their 2023 season. Gurinder Sandhu (20 not out and 2-23) steered the Thunder to victory in a low-scoring thriller Credit: Getty Images ‚ÄúIf an individual tests positive to COVID-19, and in the absence of mandatory isolation directed by relevant authorities, the club doctor is responsible for monitoring the individual‚Äôs symptoms and subsequent recovery from COVID-19. ‚ÄúThe club doctor is also responsible for managing the individual‚Äôs return to the AFL or AFLW program in an appropriate manner on a case-by-case basis (as is the process for other illnesses).

newsArray.title: IND v BAN, 1st Test: India wins toss, elects to bat first
creator: IANS
newsArray.description: After winning the toss for the first time on this tour, Rahul said India are playing three spinners -- Ravichandran Ashwin, Axar Patel and Kuldeep Yadav -- along with two fast bowlers in Umesh Yadav and Mohammed Siraj.
newsArray.content: Home | Cricket | Ind V Ban 1st Test India Win Toss Elect To Bat First Include Three Spinners With Two Pacers IND v BAN, 1st Test: India wins toss, elects to bat first After winning the toss for the first time on this tour, Rahul said India are playing three spinners -- Ravichandran Ashwin, Axar Patel and Kuldeep Yadav -- along with two fast bowlers in Umesh Yadav and Mohammed Siraj. By IANS Updated On - 10:09 AM, Wed - 14 December 22 Photo: Twitter Chattogram: India‚Äô s stand-in captain K.L. Rahul has won the toss and elected to bat first in the Test series opener against Bangladesh at the Zahur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium here on Wednesday. After winning the toss for the first time on this tour, Rahul said India are playing three spinners ‚Äî Ravichandran Ashwin, Axar Patel and Kuldeep Yadav ‚Äî along with two fast bowlers in Umesh Yadav and Mohammed Siraj. Also Read Facing open revolt in Hyderabad Cricket Association, Azharuddin remains defiant You are the greatest of all time for me: Kohli pens emotional note for Ronaldo Anushka Sharma wishes Virat Kohli on 5th wedding anniversary in quirkiest way possible ‚ÄúLooks like a good wicket and we‚Äôll put the runs on the board and use the footmarks later on to get wickets. They‚Äôve been a few injuries but that gives an opportunity to the other guys,‚Äù he said. Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan stated if he had won the toss, he would also have opted to bat first. ‚ÄúBut we‚Äôll try to get some early wickets. If you got into the history (of this ground), more wickets have fallen on the opening day (than on the final). We will try to get early wickets and put them under pressure,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a little difficult (to adapt from white-ball cricket), we‚Äôre playing a Test after a big gap of five months but we‚Äôve prepared well. This is an important series hopefully we can put some WTC points,‚Äù he added. For Bangladesh , top-order batter Zakir Hasan, who made a heroic 173 to force a draw against India A in a four-day match at Cox‚Äôs Bazar, is making his Test debut, making him the 101st cricketer in this format from his country. While India will be opening with Rahul and Shubman Gill, Bangladesh have dropped Mahmudul Hasan Joy to have their opening pair in Zakir and Najmul Hossain Shanto. India are playing Tests after five months, while Bangladesh are featuring in the format after nearly six months. India need to win their remaining six Tests (or even five victories with a draw) ‚Äì two in Bangladesh and four against Australia at home in February-March next year ‚Äì to be in contention for the World Test Championship final to be played at The Oval in June 2023. Playing XIs: India: Shubman Gill, K.L. Rahul (c), Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant (wk), Axar Patel, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Yadav, Umesh Yadav, Mohammed Siraj Bangladesh: Zakir Hasan, Najmul Hossain Shanto, Litton Das, Shakib Al Hasan (c), Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), Yasir Ali, Nurul Hasan, Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Taijul Islam, Khaled Ahmed, Ebadot Hossain Follow Us : Tags 'false' Covid tests Bangladesh India K L Rahul Related News Editorial: Covid not yet over India-China troops clash in Tawang sector, soldiers from both sides injured Editorial: Reining in the tech giants Gmail goes down for users globally, India too IND v BAN, 3rd ODI: India crush Bangladesh by 227 runs, hosts take series 2-1 IND v BAN, 3rd ODI: Ishan Kishan double hundred, Virat Kohli century propel India to 409/8

newsArray.title: India vs Australia 3rd T20I: Plenty of work still to do for hosts despite famous Super Over win
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: India vs Australia 3rd T20I: Plenty of work still to do for hosts despite famous Super Over win
newsArray.content: Cricket India vs Australia 3rd T20I: Plenty of work still to do for hosts despite famous Super Over win India won the second T20I against Australia in a Super Over to level the five-match series 1-1. FirstCricket Staff December 14th, 2022 9:20:23 IST The India-Australia T20 series is currently tied 1-1. Image: BCCI It was in a spectacular fashion that India levelled the five-match T20I series, 1-1 against Australia. Asked to chase a target of 188, India didn‚Äôt let past failures dictate terms as they held onto the nerves to first tie the match and then clinch the Super Over to secure one of the best wins in their history. Quite often India had been guilty of succumbing to pressure and losing matches from winning positions against Australia, but not on Sunday. In front of an unprecedented 47,000+ fans at the DY Patil Stadium , Harmanpreet Kaur and Co produced a performance that should surely inspire a few more to take up the sport. But as they move from Navi Mumbai to Mumbai for the third T20I of the match, they also need to move on quickly from the win. Consistency needed with bat Scoring big, batting first or second, had been an issue for India. With scores of 172 and 187 in the first two matches of the series respectively and by consistently scoring 150+ totals this year, India have shown that they can are close to decoding the winning total puzzle in the T20I format. Still, they can only be fully confident of their abilities if they can do this consistently against Australia, the T20 and ODI world champions. In fact, Australia chased down a target of 173 in the first ODI and scored 187 in the second with ease, by losing just one wicket in both matches. For India, the big scores have been a result of some inspired late-order batting by Richa Ghosh and Deepti Sharma coupled with openers Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma giving the team good starts. To score big consistently, India will need Jemimah Rodrigues to quickly find her scoring touch while Devika Vaidya who has been picked ahead of Yastike Bhatia would be looking to make an impact with the bat. All-round effort needed Australia are the gold standard in women‚Äôs cricket and for India to be like them, it will take a well-rounded team. While batters have put up the runs, the bowling has been quite underwhelming. Feilding has been horrendous. Deepti and Vedika are the only Indian bowlers to take a wicket each in two matches so far. Pacers Renuka Singh, Anjali Sarvani and Meghna Singh have all gone for runs and are yet to take a wicket. Despite Australia‚Äôs formidable batting lineup, the stats of Indian bowlers leave much to be desired. It‚Äôs possible that may include left-arm spinner Rajeshwari Gayakwad in the squad for Meghna Singh as the Brabourne Stadium may not offer a belter of the pitch like DY Patil ground. Whatever the mix, it‚Äôs important for Indian bowlers to pull up their socks. Similarly, fielding has not been up to the mark in the first two games. India‚Äôs fielding has improved drastically in recent years but there are occasional dips in the performance and that is not something that you can afford against Australia. Squads Australia: Alyssa Healy (c), Tahlia McGrath (vc), Darcie Brown, Nicola Carey, Ashleigh Gardner, Kim Garth, Heather Graham, Grace Harris, Jess Jonassen, Alana King, Phoebe Litchfield, Beth Mooney, Ellyse Perry, Megan Schutt, Annabel Sutherland India: Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Smriti Mandhana (vc), Shafali Verma, Yastika Bhatia, Jemimah Rodrigues, Deepti Sharma, Radha Yadav, Rajeshwari Gayakwad, Renuka Singh Thakur, Meghna Singh, Anjali Sarvani, Devika Vaidya, S Meghana, Richa Ghosh, Harleen Deol The 3rd T20I will start at 7 PM and will be shown live on Star Sports and Disney+ Hotstar. Read all the Latest News , Trending News , Cricket News , Bollywood News , India News and Entertainment News here. Follow us on Facebook , Twitter and Instagram . Updated Date: December 14, 2022 09:20:23 IST Tags: India Vs Australia India Women Vs Australia Women Find latest and upcoming tech gadgets online on Tech2 Gadgets. newsArray.title: Former England cricketer Andrew Flintoff hurt in Top Gear accident
newsArray.description: London, December 14 Former England cricketer Andrew "Freddie" Flintoff has been hospitalised after an accident that occurred during filming for the BBC show 'Top Gear'. The 45-year-old TV presenter was involved in the accident on Tuesday at the show's test track at Dunsfold Aerodrome in Surrey. "Freddie was injured in an accident at the Top Gear test track this morning ‚Äî with crew medics attending the scene immediately," the BBC said in a statement. "He has been taken to hospital for further treatment and we will confirm more details in due course." The BBC reported that Flintoff's injuries are not life-threatening. Flintoff, who played 79 Tests and 141 limited-overs internationals, retired from international cricket in 2009. He was the 2005 Ashes player of the series.

creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: India vs Bangladesh LIVE score 1st Test Day 1: IND look for a positive start vs BAN
newsArray.content: Bangladesh Vs India LIVE SCORE (test) Quick Scorecard Full scorecard Ball by ball commentary FP commentary Bangladesh Vs India At Zahur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium, Chattogram, 14 December, 2022 14 December, 2022 Starts 09:00 (IST) Play In Progress India 11/0 (3.3 ov) 1st Test Bangladesh Yet To Bat Live Blog India Bangladesh 11/0 (3.3 ov) - R/R 3.14 Play In Progress KL Rahul (C) - 8 Shubman Gill - 3 This Over Batting Status R B 4s 6s KL Rahul (C) Batting 8 9 2 0 Shubman Gill Batting 3 12 0 0 Bowling 0 M R W Ebadot Hossain 2 0 6 0 Khaled Ahmed 1.3 0 5 0 Current Partnership Last Wicket 0/0 (0) 11 (11) R/R: 3.14 KL Rahul (C) 8(9) Shubman Gill 3(12) 0 0(0) S.R (0) India vs Bangladesh LIVE score 1st Test Day 1: KL Rahul, Shubman Gill begin proceedings for IND vs BAN India vs Bangladesh, 1st Test, Day 1, Live cricket score and updates, ball by ball commentary: Hello and welcome to the LIVE COVERAGE of the first Test between India and Bangladesh Live Updates Highlights 09:05 (IST) India vs Bangladesh LIVE KL Rahul is off the mark with a boundary. Ebadot misses his line and length completely as it goes down the leg. KL just helps it on its way to the boundary behind Full Scorecard 09:00 (IST) India vs Bangladesh We are moments away from LIVE ACTION. Shubman Gill and KL Rahul will open the innings for India. Ebadot will bowl the first over Full Scorecard 08:49 (IST) India vs Bangladesh LIVE Playing XI Bangladesh: Zakir Hasan, Najmul Hossain Shanto, Litton Das, Shakib Al Hasan(c), Mushfiqur Rahim, Yasir Ali, Nurul Hasan(w), Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Taijul Islam, Khaled Ahmed, Ebadot Hossain Full Scorecard 08:36 (IST) India vs Bangladesh LIVE Playing XI India: Shubman Gill, KL Rahul(c), Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant(w), Axar Patel, Ravichandran Ashwin, Kuldeep Yadav, Umesh Yadav, Mohammed Siraj Full Scorecard 08:32 (IST) IND vs BAN So, the news from the Centre is that India have won the toss and they will bat first. "We'll bat first. Looks a good wicket, put runs on the board," says KL Rahul at the toss Full Scorecard 08:29 (IST) India vs Bangladesh The home side has a debutant. Zakir Hasan has been handed his Test debut and receives the cap from Shakib Al Hasan Full Scorecard 08:27 (IST) Test-mode üîõ Preps done, all set for the #BANvIND Test üëå #TeamIndia pic.twitter.com/yqX2iDXYrm ‚Äî BCCI (@BCCI) December 13, 2022 Full Scorecard 08:15 (IST) Hello and welcome to the LIVE COVERAGE of the first Test between India and Bangladesh Full Scorecard Highlights India vs Bangladesh, 1st Test, Day 1, LIVE Score: IND take on BAN in Chattogram. (Photo Source: BCCI/Twitter) PREVIEW : India and Bangladesh are all set to lock horns with each other in the first Test of the two-match series in Chattogram. The hosts clinched the ODI series after beating India 2-1 and will look to replicate the same in the Tests as well. On the other side, India will look for a positive start. The visitors have faced some injury issues with the likes of Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami being ruled out while captain Rohit Sharma unavailable for selection for the first Test due to a thumb injury. KL Rahul will lead the side in Rohit‚Äôs absence while Cheteshwar Pujara has been named his deputy. SQUADS: India: Shubman Gill, KL Rahul(c), Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant(w), Axar Patel, Ravichandran Ashwin, Shardul Thakur, Umesh Yadav, Mohammed Siraj, Kuldeep Yadav, Srikar Bharat, Navdeep Saini, Abhimanyu Easwaran, Saurabh Kumar Bangladesh: Najmul Hossain Shanto, Mahmudul Hasan Joy, Mominul Haque, Anamul Haque, Shakib Al Hasan(c), Litton Das, Mushfiqur Rahim(w), Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Taijul Islam, Ebadot Hossain, Khaled Ahmed, Shoriful Islam, Nurul Hasan, Yasir Ali, Zakir Hasan, Rejaur Rahman Raja Read all the Latest News , Trending News , Cricket News , Bollywood News , India News and Entertainment News here. creator: The News Glory
newsArray.description: Chatogram: The first match of the 2-Test series between India and Bangladesh will start at 9 am today in Chattogram. Indian cricket team is touring Bangladesh. The two teams will face each other in a 2-Test series. The first match will start today at 9 am at Jaghur Ahmed Stadium in Chattogram. The Bangladesh series [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: Chatogram : The first match of the 2-Test series between India and Bangladesh will start at 9 am today in Chattogram. Indian cricket team is touring Bangladesh. The two teams will face each other in a 2-Test series. The first match will start today at 9 am at Jaghur Ahmed Stadium in Chattogram. The Bangladesh series is crucial for the Indian team to qualify for the World Test Championship final. India are currently 4th in the World Test Championship points table. Australia, South Africa and Sri Lanka are the top 3 teams. To qualify for the final in June 2023, India will need to win the 2nd Test against Bangladesh and the next 4th Test against Australia. Only if they win all these 6 matches can they directly qualify for the final without waiting for the results of the other teams. Team India‚Äôs journey to qualify for the World Test Championship final begins today at the Jharkhand Stadium. This ground is good for batting. However, it will give way to the whirlwind in the last days. Bangladesh have yet to win a Test match against India. However, the absence of Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami and Ravindra Jadeja due to injury may give the Indian team some setback. Jadeja‚Äôs absence on such a pitch could put the opposition‚Äôs 3rd and 4th innings batting at a disadvantage. However, Axar Patel may try to fill Jadeja‚Äôs place. Apart from this, in the absence of Rohit Sharma, the Indian team is led by KL Rahul. Kuldeep Yadav or Saurabh Kumar could be in place if India decide to go with a 3rd spinner. Left-arm spinner Saurabh Kumar recently took 15 wickets in the 2-Test series against Bangladesh ‚ÄòA‚Äô. Perhaps Jaydev Unathkat or Navdeep Saini could be in place along with Umesh Yadav and Mohammad Siraj if India decide to go with 3 fast bowlers. Shubman Gill, Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant can add strength in the batting.
